snippet: The board of trustees met with the expectation of making a decision on whether to end the college’s policy on free tuition for undergraduates, but left saying they are still reviewing options.
abstract: Cooper Union board of trustees delays decision on the fate of the college's distinctive no-tuition policy for undergraduate students; says they are reviewing all options in deciding whether to end the longstanding policy.
lead_paragraph: The board of trustees met with the expectation of making a decision on whether to end the college’s policy on free tuition for undergraduates, but left saying they are still reviewing options.
